greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2, a(2n) = 2*a(n), a(2n+1) = A305421(a(n)).
comment: Note the indexing: Domain starts from 0, while range starts from 1.
This is GF(2)[X] analog of A163511.
This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. Each child to the left is obtained by doubling the parent, and each child to the right is obtained by applying A305421 to the parent:
Sequence A305417 is obtained by scanning the same tree level by level from right to left.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16383
Index entries for sequences operating on GF(2)[X]-polynomials
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: A305421(n) = { my(f = subst(lift(factor(Pol(binary(n))*Mod(1, 2))),x,2)); for(i=1,#f~,f[i,1] = Pol(binary(A305420(f[i,1])))); fromdigits(Vec(factorback(f))%2,2); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 10 2018
